definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But as a diplomat, Kissinger recollects Kennan was a hot temper in the cold war;
sentences.chinese: 但作为一位外交家，凯南可算是冷战中的一个暴脾气。

sentences.english: The elderly diplomat came to Lanny's support.
Zhou was the consummate diplomat, but also a considerable wit.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来是个完美的外交家，也同时是位智者。

sentences.english: Finally he realized his dream of being a famous diplomatist.
sentences.chinese: 最终他实现了做一个有名的外交家的梦想。

sentences.english: HARIS SILAJDZIC: "The world has lost a very able diplomat."
sentences.chinese: 我们又失去了一位有能力的外交家。
激进主义者是个糟糕的外交家。

sentences.english: Yet the diplomats are stu ck, and Iran may miscalculate that it can get away with it.
sentences.chinese: 让外交家们不解的是，伊朗可能误认为自己可以克服。

sentences.english: Like a good diplomat, I asked my parents what I should do.
sentences.chinese: 像机敏的外交家那样，我问父母我该做些什么。

sentences.english: Its few diplomats are good, but terribly overstretched.
sentences.chinese: 其优秀的外交家很少，又青黄不接。

sentences.english: The unsociable person is hardly fit for a diplomat.
sentences.chinese: 不擅社交的人几乎不适合做外交家。

sentences.english: Madame Chiang Kai-shek was a diplomat par excellence. But she was not familiar with Japanese history.
sentences.chinese: 蒋宋美龄是位杰出的外交家，只是对日本史不够熟谙。

sentences.english: He was not only a magistrate, he was almost a diplomatist.
sentences.chinese: 维尔福先生不仅是位法官，而且几乎是位外交家。

sentences.english: Both diplomats also spoke about their nations' commitments to religious tolerance.
sentences.chinese: 两位外交家还提到了各自国家对宗教宽容的承诺。

sentences.english: At last, the dream of being a famous diplomatist comes true.
sentences.chinese: 最终他实现了做一个有名的外交家的梦想。

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
